text: An empty ribbon of asphalt. Winding through an endless stretch of meadows and farmlands. For a long moment, sile Then, a distant speck. A car moving toward us.

head_text.subj: A SOUND APPROACHING WITH IT NOW. A RADIO BLARING AND TWO

text: TRISHA JAMES is a beautiful girl of twenty. Hair blowing the breeze of the open passenger window. She sings out, banging the side of the car with her hand. Keeping the be of the boisterous rock song. She sings with younger brother DARRY. Nineteen. Attractiv like his sister. Lighter hair. Softer looking. Striking e Voice raised as they speed along. Trying to swallow up th road as quickly as possible. The backseat has a couple of suitcases and a large basket wrapped in a garbage bag. The song comes to an end as Dar flies through an abandoned intersection.
That was a stop sign.
You're kidding, right?
In your car I'd be kidding.

You think we're actually gonna run into anyone else on this road? Relax! (turns the radio louder, shouts over it) Enjoy the countryside! The ANGRY MUSIC WAILING and the car blasting down the tranquil road. We watch as it heads for what seems like infinity. EXT. LONELY COUNTRY ROAD. DAY. SOME TIME LATER.
Okay, here comes... Trish and Darry slowing down now. Coming up on a camper/trailer. Brother and sister stare at the license plate:
DARRY (cont'd) (reads it loudly) "Six A Forever!" (grins) That's mine! That's five to five. Tied up.
What does it mean? (off his look) "Six A Forever" what does it mean?
I don't know.
‘Cause it says "Sexy Forever", stupid, that's mine. That's five to four.
Since when did you start ace- ing me at this game?

Since you were ten. It involves English and reading. Darry guns the engine. Goes into the oncoming lane to pas the camper/trailer. TRISH (cont'd) Come on, Darry. They pass the cab of the truck. An OLD MAN of sixty behin the wheel. His WIFE next to him. He glares down at Trish Darry as they pass him.
Sexy forever huh?
You know that is you in forty years.
Note to self: Die young. (checks his rearview) Any place but here on this unbelievably endless road.
You wanna be sucking in exhaust fumes on the Interstate?
No I love stopping at train tracks every ten minutes. No further comment from big sister. She's suddenly some p else. DARRY (cont'd) You know there's usually a reason when you like the long way home.
Gee like, maybe I like the country?
(mocking sincerity) Okay.
Just drive, brat.
I'm only thinking the same thing mom and dad are gonna be thinking: how come you're driving home for Spring break with baby brother? Not heading off somewhere with "Mr .Poly-Sci-Track-Team-Guy"?
And I'11 tell you what I'd tell them: none of your Goddamned business-
(swerves a little) Jesus! The van is tailgating them at an alarming velocity. Rattl and shimmying it is so old and distressed.
Darry!
What's this guy trying to do?! He tries to find the driver in the rearview. The Van's windshield is heavily tinted.
Just get out of his way!
He's nuts!

(emphatically) Get out of his way, Darry! Darry swerves into the oncoming lane and the van tears forward. Blasting toward the distant horizon. Both brother and sister watch breathless. Catching its rusting and personalized license plate: TRISH (cont'd) Jesus!
(back in the right lane) Shit!
What the Hell is his problem?

My first guess: inbreeding! He has shouted this last word out the window toward the distant van. DARRY (cont'd) Get a load of that thing? Vehicle of choice for five out of ten serial killers. Brother and sister still trying to catch their breath as van disappears over a distant rise.
God you know what I just thought of, right?
Kenny and Darla. (off Trish's nod) They died about a hundred miles from here.
It was the same highway.
This highway runs the length of the State.
You think it really happened?
That they had to go looking for her head?
No that they never found her. Or him. They only found the car.
No, they never found her head. They found the car but they couldn't find him or her head.
Look at me... (holds out her hand) I'm still shaking.
You don't think every generation has their cautionary tale of drinking and driving on Prom Night?
I always heard it was real. That they were Class of '80. After I heard that story, I used to think this was the highway I_ would die on.
Quite the cheery thinker, today. What did "Poly-sci guy do to you anyway?

She isn't listening. Thoughts elsewhere again. DARRY (cont'd) “Beating you" (off her look) That was the license plate on the van: B-E-A-T-N-G-U". (turns to her) “Beating you", that's five to five. That ties us up.
You can't call it now.
My ass...
You have to call it when you see it!

I was in shock! THE JANGLING BELLS OF A RAILROAD CROSSING AHEAD. DARRY (cont'd) You know I don't remember there being so many rules to this game. Trish and Darry slowing as the bells ring and the bars lo DARRY (cont'd) ‘Course when there was, you were the one making ‘em. Little Miss Junior Nazi with the Barbie Doll and the Easy Bake Oven... Darry looks down the tracks. Sees the small cargo train approaching. Revs the engine.
Don't you dare. (off his look) My car. Trish sniffs. Smells something. Looks in the backseat. Th big thing covered in a trash bag. She lifts the plastic: full laundry basket.
TRISH (cont'd) You are a class act, you know that?
Hey you live off campus. (she just stares at him) You ever try and do laundry in a dorm? What they don't steal they dye pink for you. I've got twelve pair of rosey-pink jockey shorts.

Maybe they know something about you, you don't. She takes the Deodorizer hanging off the rearview mirror stuffs it in the bag. TRISH (cont'd) Hi mom, haven't seen you forever, here's my dirty shorts. The train is upon them now. He shouts over the din.

Its for her, not me. I have to bring home laundry. I don't, she gets depressed. Like she thinks I don't need her anymore or something. Trish's look says she isn't buying it. The SHORT TRAIN RO PAST. Leaves the car waiting for bells to stop and the ba to rise.
You talk to her lately?
To tell her I'd be home for break.
She sound like anything was going on? Darry throws her a look.
(impatient) Did you listen to her voice?
Specify please.

I think maybe something's wrong. (off his look) I don't think they're telling us. (off his continued look) Like you would notice anything past the point of your own selfish little existence. The bars go up and the car flies over the tracks. Continu its trek down the two-lane.
If mom and dad were gonna get a divorce don't you think they'd have done it by now?
No I think they would've waited till we were both grown and off at school.
Whatever.
She's not happy. Not even a little bit. Not like she used to be.

Who is? (spots something) Hey... They are driving past an old abandoned church set back fr the road. DARRY (cont'd) You see it? Her sister peers past him. In the church's side yard, the van is parked. The one that almost ran them off the road. DARRY (cont'd) It's "Beating You".
What's he doing?
But what they both see now is something much more ominous A tall, dark figure dropping something large and oblong d an old drainage pipe in the back of the church.
What the Hell is that... The oblong object is gone in an instant. Swallowed up by large mouth of the old protruding pipe. The kid's view blocked now by the church.
Don't slow down!
You think he saw us?
What the Hell was he doing?
He dumped something down that pipe.
Wrapped in a sheet.
Wrapped and roped in a sheet.
Wrapped and roped in a sheet with red stains on it. Both of them study the rearview mirror now. TRISH (cont'd) Vehicle of choice for five out of ten what? Darry guns the engine.
I don't think he saw us.
Don't get us killed.
You see him? Both watch the old church get smaller in their view.
Nope. Someone appears high on the old roof. Standing next to th sagging steeple.

What the- Appears so suddenly it could almost be the Figure had lea up there. Darry stares at this, perplexed. DARRY (cont'd) You see that? She hasn't. Just the distant figure on the roof, looking after them. Some kind of long coat flapping in the wind l a cape.
Just get us out of here Darry! The figure drops from view as quickly as he appeared. A glance between brother and sister and Darry increases s
Grab my cell phone!
Where?
In the gym bag! Trish starts rummaging. Finds the cell phone. Flips it op Powers it up. Staring back at the church. THE PHONE GIVES OUT A LOW BATTERY ALERT.
The point of having a portable phone idiot, is so that it works when you need it.
I have a power cable for it!
(stuffs the phone back in the bag) (MORE )
TRISH (cont'd) And I have a cigarette lighter that doesn't work!
I told you we shoulda’ taken my car! Trish pales. Staring out the back. In the distance the dark van is now leaving the old churc and taking the road again.
Oh Jesus... Heading toward them.

(in the rearview) You gotta be kidding me... THEY CAN HEAR THE VAN'S DISTANT ENGINE BEING GUNNED.... Darry floors it, the little car ripping down the highway the old van swoops after it -looking like a dark bird of prey. Darry staring down at the speedometer. He's up to ninety the little car is starting to shake. Darry checks the rearview mirror. The van still gaining.
What the Hell's he got in that thing? He's got it suped up or something- The car speeds down the two lane trying desperately to ke but the van continues to gain -SCREAMING TOWARD THEM.
Darry!!! He's right on our ass!!!

I can see him! The van is only a few yards from them now. Darry's foot slamming the pedal to the metal. He and she staring back at the van's tinted windshield. Glints in the sun. No driver can be seen.
DARRY (cont'd) Hang on-
Darry-
I'm gonna try something.

Darry don't kill us... He is staring up ahead at a gravel road that shoots sharp off the highway. Just as the van lurches up to their rear bumper -its dark face and grill filling the rear and sideview mirrors. TRISH (cont'd) Darry what're you doing?

Jesus Christ- BAM! THE VAN SLAMS THE BACK OF THE CAR. At its top speed, the car shimmies and shakes. Darry weav in and out of the oncoming lane several times before regaining control. DARRY (cont'd) I don't believe this- WOOOONNNNKKKKKK! !!!! THE HORN FROM THE VAN BLARES -but i a sound they have never heard come from an auto before. This could almost be the deep, guttural sound of a wailin beast.
What the Hell does he want?! (screaming out the back) Are you out of your fucking mind?!!! WHAM! The van hits the back of the sedan again.
Christ! Darry almost in tears. Trying desperately to control the as it crosses the oncoming lane and roughly lurches onto dirt shoulder.

The sedan shakes violently as Darry tries to get it back asphalt again. His sister screams -a big ditch dead ahead. Darry grapple the wheel and as the sedan spits up dirt, he swings the c back onto asphalt again. The van tails them across the oncoming lane and back acro the highway. WOOOONNNKKKKK! !! THE STRANGE, BRUTAL HORN WAILS AGAIN. Darry is almost up to the gravel road that shoots off the lane. DARRY (cont'd) Hang on! Trish just stares at her brother. The boy is shaken. Eyes full of fear. She looks back at the van. It is charging a at them again.

What the fuck is the matter with you?!!!! WHAMM!!! Struck again from behind -Darry really loses control. Tries to swing onto the gravel roadway -but leav the two lane at a terrifying speed, unable to negotiate t sharp turn. Blasting through a wooden fence and into an open field. Darry slams on his brakes as they rocket into tall grass. The windshield is whipped with grass as the car's brakes up and the vehicle continues to fly forward. A cloud of birds flutters out of the deep grass in front them as inside the car, brother and sister are tossed aro like ragdolls. Trish trying desperately to fasten her seatbelt. Darry ju leaning into that brake. TRISH (cont'd) Goddammitt!!! The car swings around and stops. Jostling to a halt in so even taller grass and bringing a sudden and eerie silence Only the breathing of brother and sister can be heard ins the car.

That and the sound of the van's engine pounding away in t distance. Out Trish's dirtied window, she can see the highway throu the grass. She and Darry stare out. The old van is not even slowing. Continuing at its terrif speed down the two lane. Brother and sister staring after it. Breathless as it disappears in the distance. They look at each other. Both seem to be intact. Without word, Darry opens the car door. In some kind of shock. Ta a step out. ANOTHER GAGGLE OF BIRDS SUDDENLY FLAPPING THEIR WINGS. Blasting out from deep grass beyond Darry. Scares the shi out of him.

You fuckers! Picks up a rock. Throws it at their ascending cloud. Need take out his anger and frustration. Picks up another one. Looks over at his sister. Trish is standing now, staring out at the highway. The va long gone. DARRY (cont'd) Still like the country? She turns and looks at him. DARRY (cont'd) The next time Poly-Sci guy pisses you off I'm gonna kick his fucking ass! Trish just looks at the car, surrounded by the tall grass EXT. GRAVEL ROAD. DAY. MINUTES LATER. Dirtied and scraped, the small car emerges slowly from th tall grass. Trish behind the wheel now. Darry looking out passenger window. They back out of the field. Through the opening in the wo fence that they made going in. Roll the car onto the grav drive.
Pointed again toward the highway, Trish guns the engine b doesn't move. Looks to her brother.
Sounds alright, I guess.
Like either of us would know.
(defending his manhood) I know a little.
When your car makes a strange noise you just buy a new tape Darry, that's what you told me.
Told you? I learned it from you!
Asshole.
Bitch.
Mama's boy.
Daddy's whore.
Dick Licker.
Ball sniffer.
Ass kisser.
Butt picker.
Hah! Repeat! Ass and butt! You lose. Looks over at Trish and smiles. She too. They need a smil about now.
Trish rolls to the end of the gravel drive. Stops at the highway. Looks both ways. Darry's hand on the wheel sudde

I'm thinking past the point of my own selfish little existence now, okay? What if that really was a person he dumped down that pipe? What if it was someone still alive? Trish just stares at her brother. DARRY (cont'd) Someone who needs help but doesn't get it. Or doesn't get it ‘till it's too late.
We can get help just as fast by getting to a phone-
You know how far we are from the nearest pay phone?
Is this your idea of an adventure or something? 'Cause this is why girls are smarter, okay?

Hey we almost got killed! You don't wanna even find out why?! She isn't wanting or liking this. DARRY (cont'd) We look in the pipe. That's all we do. (off her look) We look in the pipe and if there's nothing there or nothing we can do, we just drive on home and call the cops. Trish stares unwilling.
DARRY (cont'd) You know I'm right.
Bullshit I do!

Look me straight in the eye and tell me I'm not right. She won't look at him. He knows he has her now. DARRY (cont'd) Come on, right in the eye. She turns and glares at him as she throws the car in gear

I'm not getting out of the car. Darry smiles. Trish heads out onto the highway. Back towa the old church. EXT. OLD CHURCH. LATE DAY. MINUTES LATER. The car stops on the empty two-lane just before the old church. Darry and Trish regard it. Check the rearview too Empty road. Empty church yard.
Every bone in my body is telling me not to do this.

Where would men be if they spent their lives listening to women's bodies? She gives him a look. Rolls into the drive. The old churc sagging and gray and has not been a place of worship in m years. They drive around the side. Both staring up at the old steeple. And the THREE BLACK CROWS perched on the cross w one arm has rotted off. The back of the place is covered in soil. No parking lot. Just moist dirt and leaves. Mulch. And ahead, through the windshield, the large drain pipe sticking out of the grou Trish drives slowly toward it. Stops a few yards away. Lo at her brother. Suddenly Darry doesn't look so brave eith
I'm just gonna look.

You look like you're gonna puke. Darry opens the car door. Gets out. Looks out to the high Then the surrounding woods in back of the church. No one. Moves toward the old pipe when the sound of his sister tu his head.

Let's do this and do it fast. They approach the pipe warily. It is corrugated metal and sticks out of the ground about three feet. Angled into th ground, its jagged metal mouth is about three feet wide.
Drainage pipe or something? Trish and Darry stare down the dark tunnel. A breeze come out of it. And a terrible stench...
Oh my God... She covers her mouth and stares at her brother.
That breeze has to come from somewhere.
Somewhere rank.
Doesn't look like a sewer pipe.
Come on Darry! We can't see anything down there!
(nods to the car) You gotta flashlight? She throws him a cold look. Moves back to the car. Darry stares down into the pitch.
Hello? Listens to his echo.

Anybody down there? Again his voice rebounding. Looks back toward the car whe the smallest of sounds drifts up the pipe. Darry whirls back to it. Stares in. SOMEWHERE DOWN IN THE DARK, A MURMUR. A SOFT, MUFFLED, HUMAN SOUND.
Hello? (to Trish) Hurry up! Trish brings the flashlight. Darry grabs it out of her ha Shines it down the long length of metal.
Hello?! (off her look) There's someone down there! I just heard them! (again into the dark) Hello?! The light reveals dark earth at the bottom of the pipe. S twenty-five feet down.
You're hearing things. Darry tests the strength of the pipe. It is anchored soli in the ground.
Darry, don't even think about it. He hoists himself up into the mouth.
I told you I heard someone! Crouched inside the pipe, he stares down. Holds the flashlight with one hand and the lip of the tube with the other.

You know the part in scary movies where somebody does something really stupid and everybody hates them for it? (off his look) This is it! A small, scuffling sound from below. Trish hears this. Darry stares down the tunnel, darkness with the flashlight. Looks back at her. expression asks her Did you hear that?! Now worming his way further into the opening of
No Darry!
Let me slide down-
Goddamnitt
Just let me get a little way in-
You're not going down there!
I'm not! Just hold my feet. 20 raking the His the tunnel. As he lays down inside the tube, flashlight extended, Tri grabs her brother's ankles.
Anybody down there?
God when was the last time you washed any socks?
I see something! He strains to look back at her. Trish too scared to comme
(shouts down again) Hello?
I'm counting to ten Darry.
Something's moving down there...
Then I am letting go and going back to my car-
Quiet! (peers forward) I just saw it again. Something is definitely moving down here- Moving alright -directly into Darry's flashlight beam. TW TERRIFIED RATS -darting directly at him.
Abbhhh!!!!!
Darry!!!!!
Rats!!!! The rodents run right up over his shoulders. He screams. Thrashes. They scurry onto his back. Rushing up...
(trying to keep hold of his kicking feet) It's what?!

It's rats!!!! But he doesn't need to tell her. The rats run right at he now! One down each of Darry's legs! Trish screams -releasing her brother's still thrashing fe It's a tie who screams louder: Trisha stumbling back as t rats leap to the ground -or brother Darry as he slides al the way down the large pipe. A GREAT THUD BELOW. Trish charges toward the pipe as the rodents scurry into the leaves.
Darry!?
Her voice echoes into darkness as she stares down.
Darry?!

Owww! Fell right on my head. INT. SUBTERRANEAN ROOM. CHURCH. LATE DAY. SAME TIME. Darry rubs his neck. Winces in the dark. Rust and dust trickle down from the pipe. He sits in the dim pool of daylight from above. Squints up into it.
Why'd you let go?!
How the Hell're you gonna get out of there, idiot! Darry stands slowly. Looks up the drain pipe.

I can climb out, relax your crack. He bends and gropes for the flashlight outside the circle light. Finds it. Switches it on. The first thing the light hits, is the edge of something wrapped in a bloody sheet. Darry stops. This is what they saw being dumped down the tube.
Darry? Brother doesn't answer. Takes a terrified step toward it.
Do it then, climb out please. There can be no question it is a body. Blood stains on th head and midsection. Sheet around it. Tied with rope at t neck and ankles.
Say not so, sis.
h (peering down) What?
(to himself now) Say not so... He bends to it. Studies the head as he pales.
Hello? Feels like an idiot talking to it. But does anyway.
Did I hear you down here? No response. Swallows. Has no choice but to touch it. Gen on the arm. Pushes it. Testing it.
Darry what in the Holy Hell are you doing down there?!
I found our body.
You found what? Darry still staring at. Paling.
I found the body. Darry starts to get up. Grabbed! By a hand! DARRY WAILS. Lurches away from it, stumbling back. The bo is moving under its bloody sheet. Twitching. Trying to breathe.
Oh God!
Darry?
Oh God!!! Darry dashes toward it. Crashes to his knees. Starts tear at the sheet around its head.

The sheet being sucked in and out around the mouth now. I gasping for air. Darry trying to tear the sheet. To get a grip on it. The thrashes. Finally -RIPPPPPPP!!!!!! The sheet tears away and Darry stares down in shock. It is A YOUNG MAN. About his age. Deathly gray. Mouth ope mute agony. Eyes wide. Blinking up at him. Darry can only stare in terror. He doesn't know what to d Frantically grabs the sheet. Tears it the rest of the way down the body -stopping abruptly. The young man's bare body has an incision of ugly black stitches --all the way from the navel to the neck. Darry thinks he might be sick. Looks up into those wide e What in God's name did someone do to you? Both boys stare at each other helplessly.
Darry?
(can whisper back) Trish... The boy's dry, blue lips are opening. The Adam's apple bo as he tries to swallow. Darry crazy with fear, leans down His ear at the boy's lips as they part again.
What? A whispered word comes out of his mouth. Choked. Raspy. Unintelligible.
What did you say? But no more sound comes. Nor breathing. Darry staring wid eyed. Almost catatonic. Backs off him. Slowly.
I am up here all Goddamned alone little brother! Now get your ass up here, it is getting dark!
Her angry voice echoes down. Darry moves to the puddle of light and looks up at her.
Is she dead?
He.

Come on, before that guy comes back! Darry nods. Goes to hoist a foot up into the tube but sto His flashlight has swept over something else outside the of daylight. He throws the light along the damp earth, past the lifele body of the boy and over to... Two more bloody, sheet-wrapped bodies. Piled on top of ea other. Darry in shock... Stares numbly at them. Swallows. Starts his head 'no'. Cannot accept this. Will not accept this. Darry charging now, back toward the pool of daylight. EXT. OLD CHURCH. LATE DAY. SAME TIME. Above, Trish sees him hoist himself into the tube and sta furious, frightened climb toward daylight.
Darry? A climb so violent the pipe rocks and shimmies. Rivulets soot and rust trickling down the metal surface.

What's the matter... But little brother isn't answering. Just clamoring desperately to get back up top and away from this place forever... Halfway up he slips. THE PIPE GROANS as he tries to get n footing.
Be careful!
He looks up at her. His face is dirty and his eyes wide w child-like horror.
This whole thing is moving... He catches his breath, still staring up at her.

Say something Darry, you're scaring the shit out of me! Darry starts up again. His sister reaching down toward hi Slow crane up: moving above the pipe and above the church High enough to look down the lonely two-lane: And see a van headed toward them in the distance... Darry reaches up for his sister's hand as the PIPE SHRIEK AGAIN. More soot dislodging. Running past him.
Shhh!!! She hears THE APPROACHING ENGINE. Looks down at little br
Someone's coming... (off his look) Someone's coming!!! In a new panic he grabs Trish's hand. With a concerted ef big sis pulls little brother up to the mouth of the pipe.

(trying to look behind her) Hurry!!!! WRRANNKKKKK! !!! The pipe makes A NEW, SHRILLER KIND OF SOUND... and Darry can feel the entire thing shift. Really clutching his sister's hand now. Grabs the lip of pipe with the other. But a piece of its jagged, torn meta stabs into his palm. He yells. Retracts his hand violently. Loses his footing. Slides out of Trish's grip. Down he goes again. Thrashing the way.
Darry!

Gets his footing halfway down. Examines the gash in his h when PING! PING! Just beneath his sneakers, the rusty wel holding the lengths of the pipe together -snap! Darry in the middle of the tube. Staring up at his sister with wide eyes. AS A LOW, ACHING METAL GROAN BEGINS, BUIL QUICKLY.... Darry scrambling up toward the mouth as he realizes what about to happen. Almost to the top when the bottom half of the massive tub falls away. Darry sliding down again with the great jolt. Both he and the pipe plummeting down into the darkness in great cacophony of sound and dust.

Darrrrry! Tries to see through the cloud of dust that shoots up out the tube AS THE SOUND OF THE APPROACHING VAN GETS LOUDER. She whirls toward the highway. Dashes toward her car. Hud in front of it. Peers around the left front wheel. Her he racing. The van comes into view... But not a dark van. This is another, newer van. And it continues down the two-lane without ever stopping. INT. SUBTERRANEAN ROOM. CHURCH. DUSK. MOMENTS LATER. Darry sitting on the ground against the fallen half of th pipe staring at the gash in his hand. Stares up with Tris voice.
It wasn't him.
You know you really suck! (stands, holding his arm) In the moment of truth you really don't know how to hang on do you? You just suck-
You were the one who wanted to come back here and have a little adventure!
28 Darry is staring over at the bodies. The two still in she He stares up at his sister again.
Well I hope there's another way outta there.
_ (angry) Well it's a church basement so I'm guessing the church! The sagging old church. Especially forboding as she regar
You don't think I'm going in there?
You have to stay out front and watch for people. (off her look) You see anyone? Flag ‘em down! Tell ‘em to get the cops out here right away! Trish liking this less and less.
I'm gonna find a way up. He starts to move off but calls her again.
Trish? (off her look) You see that van coming, you get back to this pipe and holler down as loud as you can. Now she couldn't like the whole idea less. Darry staring those bodies again.
I gotta find the flashlight. Trish hurries to the car. Keeping an eye on the old highw She gets in. Starts the engine.

location: SUBTERRANEAN ROOM. LATE DAY. SAME TIME.

text: Darry takes the flashlight out from under the fallen leng of pipe. Tries it. It still works. Letting his light lead him, he moves forward.. Ahead: the other two bodies. Piled together. These bloodstains are darker. Browner. How long have they been here? Darry draws in a breath. The smell is getting putrid. In the same moment his light ascends. There are words ove his head. An epitaph, spelled out in bones:

head_text.subj: WHERE THERE'S A HELL THERE'S A

text: Darry really gets a chill now. Doesn't want to wonder if those are human bones. Arranged as they are, on a high ar that leads into a larger, darker subterranean room. Where a hand is sticking out of the wall. His light falls over it. The skin on its splayed fingers looks petrified. Is this a human hand? No question: The rest of the body is part of the wall. Skin leathered with age. Like beef jerky. Teeth infected termites... Head back, mouth open in a scream long gone silent. A body in a wall. But more light reveals more horror. A WALL of bodies.

Oh no... oh God... Darry steps forward, knees shaking. The vast room ahead, walled with dozens of these mounted corpses. Men and women of all ages. Body after body. Stitched together in a hideous tapestry. Large stitches. Identical to those just uncovered beneath that bloody she

Darry swings the light to the other side of the chamber. Another grotesque mural of the dead, extending deep into darkness ahead... God how many bodies are down here? Darry moves forward -drawn by his own need to prove none this can possibly be real! Some bodies are turned away. Skeletal heads looking back their shoulders -petrified backsides showing more stitche Several are as armless as the Venus DeMilo. Some missing other limbs. Heads. Feet. Genitals. Darry's growing repulsion moves him faster -how big is th room? Feels like a football field... Deeper along the hideous walls, Darry turns abruptly. Two withered corpses in the tapestry. On the finger of one: a large ring. An old Varsity ring. beam reflecting off its dusty jeweled surface. Darry star at it with unquestionable recognition. Looks slowly to the corpse beside it. A girl? Go. Trish guns the engine and the car screams back down the highway. The dark figure watches this from afar. Still as a statue INT. TRISH'S CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME.
What is this guy? Sees her brother staring out the rear.
What is this guy, Trish? What'd he do to those cops?
Don't know and don't wanna.
And why didn't he do it to us? You see the way he looked at us? (looks back at her) (MORE )

DARRY (cont'd) Like he's playing with us. Like running us off the road was just some kind of game. EXT. LONELY COUNTRY ROAD. NIGHT. Back at the scene of the crime, the empty patrol car, eng running, rolls slowly off the highway and into a field. The dark Figure watches only for a moment -moving away wh the car still travels pilotless deeper into the field. Before it even settles, WE CAN THE HEAR THE RUMBLE OF THE DARK VAN'S ENGINE. We leave the patrol car for a glimpse the highway when- WOOSHHH!!! The dark van rips past us down the moonlit two lane.

location: ANOTHER STRETCH OF COUNTRY ROAD. NIGHT. MINUTES LATE

text: Both Trish and Darry see it at the same time. A farmhouse Down a gravel drive off the road. Lights on in the window
There's a phone!
You sure you wanna stop?!
I wanna get to anyone who can help us!
What's the next town?
I don't know and I'm not gonna wait to find out. Trish takes the gravel drive. Jostles down the lane.
Look we just ask to use the phone, okay? We don't freak these people out. The house comes into more detail. Old and sagging. But it warmly lit windows like a beacon. Of safety. Sanity.

We don't wanna scare 'em. We just wanna call for help. Headlights etching the overgrown garden that is the front yard. An ancient pick-up to one side. In the center of th overgrowth, a sagging thing scarcely presuming to be a scarecrow.
Too spooky. Trish looks at him. He's serious.
Too spooky. Let's just get the Hell outta here. At the outskirts of the yard, a plastic sunflower ticks a in a night breeze as the car comes to a halt.
It's pretty run down. Hope they have a phone.
I hope they have a gun.

I hope they don't. She opens the door. Gets out. Darry too. Their first look to the highway. Empty. For as far as the eye can see. KER-CLINK! THE DISTINCT SOUND OF A RIFLE BEING COCKED tur the kids quickly toward the house.
Who are you? A WOMAN'S RASPY VOICE. From a silhouette behind the scree door. A blue-black rifle barrel glinting in its hands.
I said who are you?
Patricia James. This is my brother Darry.
What 'cha want?
A telephone?
Ain't got one. The kids look at each other. A whispered aside:
You know it's not too late to keep driving and not stop ‘till we see people.
What do you think she is?
Crazy?
Whatcha' need it for?
Someone's been killed. A police officer. Down the road. The screen door opens now and THE CAT LADY steps out. A strange looking woman of fifty or so. Very intense around eyes. MEOWWW...

We just came from there- Sounds of cats at her feet. She pushes a couple back inside the screen with a foot. A foot wearing a fuzz pink slipper. Darry staring down at the felines. Remembers instantly th strange phone call at the diner. Did you see the cats yet The Woman gun still
It's a ways back. You can't see it from here. levels her eyes at the two. Judging them. Her shot clenched tightly.
All right one call. (off their looks) But be quick, my babies they don't like strangers. Trisha just stares at the old woman. She has children?

Trish climbs the porch steps. Sees Darry still staring do at the cats inside the door. Trisha doesn't understand. Makes a face that tells him to hurry up! He starts forward. Cat Lady opens the screen fo them -again holding one feline inside with a fuzzy slippe
Careful. I don't let ‘em out after dark.
How many cats do you have?

More than a couple, I'm afraid. INT. CAT LADY'S HOUSE. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish and Darry halt instantly as they step inside: The living room is covered with cats. All kinds. All shap All sizes. There must be forty of them in the living room alone.
Phone's there by the love seat. The Cat Lady shuts the front door and steps past them. St the rifle in a closet. Trish covers her nose with a hand. Makes a face at Darry. smell is terrible.
Policeman killed you say? Darry still caught in an uneasy trance. That phone call. you see the cats yet?
Let's get out of here. Trish looks at him like he's crazy. The Cat Lady turns to them now. Trish lowers her hands from her nose.
People think they can drive like maniacs ‘round here. Cops too, damned fools. (MORE )
CAT LADY (cont'd) Just a bunch of punk kids with badges and guns if you ask me. Trish moves to the phone. It too surrounded by felines. Scatters a few as she reaches down and lifts the receiver
Who is that making a call on your telephone, hmm? Who is that? She is asking the one cat that remains. Sniffing Trisha a she dials.
That's the thing about cats. (off Darry's look) Can whiff a bad egg a mile away. Can't they Tomfoolery? Darry realizes she is referring to the cat that now rubs itself against his legs.
Oh he likes you. Lookee that. He wants you to pick him up. Darry nods. Tries to press out a polite smile.
Don't be afraid. Darry bends. Pets the cat's head.
Go on! Big boy like you's not afraid of a little pussy is he? He regards her. Did she just say that? Must mean somethin else. He lifts the cat into his arms. Pets its head.
There you go. (steps away) Big thing like you can't go through his life being afraid of a sweet little pussy. She winks at him this time -lecherously. Darry swallows. means what she means.
Yes, Patrica James. We just left Trentdale with a police escort.
(filtered) Are you calling the Trentdale County sheriff's department?
I thought I was.
Trentdale's the next County over. You're in Poho County now, you crossed the County line.
Look I don't know exactly where the house is I'm calling from- She looks to the Cat Lady to tell her the address, but sh shaking her head adamantly.
Don't bring the cops out here! They try and bust my ass every year with their zoning crap! (to Darry) Try and tell people how many cats a person can have!

(filtered) You said you needed to report an emergency? But the VOICE IS SUDDENLY SWALLOWED BY ANGRY STATIC ON TH LINE. Trish holds the phone away from her ear. Cat Lady and Darry watching. She clicks the clicker. Puts phone back to her ear. Nothing.
Your phone just went dead. She is looking at her brother and thinking the worse. The Cat Lady marches over to hear for herself. Puts the p to her ear as the lights go out all over the house.

Darry, Trish, the Cat Lady and her many fuzzy minions suddenly plunged into darkness. Darry rushing to the window -the cat still in his arms. EXT. FARMHOUSE. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Out in the overgrown garden, the plastic sunflower again clicks to a stop in the silent, moonlit yard. INT. FARMHOUSE. NIGHT. SAME TIME.

There's nobody out there. Then every cat in the place lifts its head in unison. Forty pairs of cat's eyes staring toward the front window Trish and Darry watching this. As growing from every corn of the room, are the wicked hisses of frightened cats everywhere. The cat in Darry's arms freaks -clawing and thrashing to itself.

Ouch!!! He winces in pain as THE ANIMAL YOWLS and hits the floor running. Cat Lady rushing to the front window. Trish and Darry with her. The overgrown yard is dark with inky shadows. Her distres scarecrow standing in the middle of it. MORE CATS HISSING. Fur standing on end. Fangs bared. What is out there, these animals do not like it.
I'll be Goddamned! The Cat Lady storming back to the closet for her rifle. T kids looking after her.
That's not my scarecrow.

Shot rolling slowly toward: The inky silhouette of the scarecrow. It is larger than we remember it. And better dressed. In a long black coat... The Figure stands before the old hay-stuffed thing-creati single silhouette. Cutting a tall, dark shadow against the starry night sky. with eyes we can barely discern. Eyes that might not belong to any human thing... INT. FARMHOUSE. NIGHT. SAME TIME. The cats are going berserk. Two of them topple the phone table. Others run in confused circles around the couch. Several scramble over the base of the floor lamp. Send it its side with a loud crash. Still others are scaling the drapes --clawing their way toward the ceiling... The Cat Lady watches puzzled by her felines.
Who the Hell is that? Cocks the rifle loudly and throws open the front door. Le the rifle at the scarecrow.
You gotta ‘bout ten seconds to get your ass outta my yard! The Scarecrow/Figure stands. Continues to stare in at the Silhouetted in the moonlight.
Don't think I'm gonna tell you twice. It's voice. Strange. A raspy whisper.
My children. Trish and Darry exchange glances.
What? A chilling whisper in the night:
I've come for my children. Trish and Darry frozen by these words. The old woman turn look at them. When the Figure bolts toward the house! Cat Lady whirls about. Fires. KA-BLAM!!!

head_text.subj: THE SCARECROW DISINTEGRATES. RIPPING INTO SHADOWY BITS TH
EXPLODE IN EVERY DIRECTION. SOMETHING LARGER RIPPING SKYW

text: The Figure is gone. Vanished into thin air. Unless... Cat Lady, Darry and Trish crowd the doorway trying to see out. Darry's gaze caught by something high. Catches a terrifying glimpse of it scrambling up the fron the house. Like some horrible caped insect. As if gravity simply did not exist.

What in the Holy- His cutting whispers turns the women to him. Stares at th in shock. KER-KRASH!!!! A WINDOW BREAKS SOMEWHERE UPSTAIRS. All thr whirl around. Staring up at the ceiling. Then cats are dropping past the front windows. Dropping d into the yard. From the second story? They land on their feet. Scurrying off into the night.... Trish and Darry look at each other with mounting panic... Cat Lady looks to brother and sis. What the Hell did you bring into my house?

head_text.subj: AS SUDDENLY A FRIGHTENED AND VOCAL TORRENT OF CATS RUSH I
WITH THE SOUND FROM ABOVE, OF ONE CAT CLEARLY ATTACKING -

text: Cat lady storms toward the stairs brandishing her rifle.
Get away from my babies you sons-of-a-bitches!
Don't! Darry charges for her. Grabs the old woman.
Don't go up there!
Goddammit!!!
Leave now!! With us!
Goddammit!!! (screaming up the stairs) Don't you hurt my babies- She catches Darry in the groin with a nasty kick. HE YELP Crumples as she charges up the steps.
Darry!!! Sis hurries to him. Starts dragging him toward the front door. She just wants out. Wants to go!
I'1l blow your Goddamned head off- But at the top of the stairs, the Cat Lady is suddenly wrenched off her feet! The kids watch as her fuzzy pink slippers disappear from view. Straight up.

head_text.subj: THEY HEAR HER GASP ONLY ONCE. NOW A CHOKED, GARGLING SOUN

text: The kids staring up at the top step where here feet vanis The cats are in absolute frenzy. Some baring fangs in the direction of the stairs, others climbing the old drapes o the place in a frantic panic to get out. To get away. Trish dashing back toward the front door with injured Dar Halted by the sight of those slippers -slipping now, slow back into view on the top step. Something just out of sight at the top of the stairs is holding her there. Feet dangling. One slipper falls off. Darry approaches in horror. Wants to see up those stairs. Wants to see just what the Hell this thing is... At the foot of the stairs he looks up. Can see her body hanging there, lifeless -held in the iron grip of the lon coated Figure --pulling the old woman into him as if she a doll.

And sniffing. Sniffing her. The same way he did the offic decapitated head. Darry throws a look to his sister: at the door, hand on t knob -frozen by her brother's paling expression. Darry looks back: the Figure takes another long inhale an then peers around the dangling old woman. Out of the shad and down the stairs --directly at him. For the first time Darry sees its face clearly: Though the features are human. The glaring blind whites o the eyes -where pupils should be- give a much more terrif impression. Not of something human but of something else. Something dark and powerful that only wears the guise of human. ...Something utterly horrible and without conscien It stares at him a chilling moment longer. Again its rasp voice whispering from its lips.

She doesn't smell too good, Darry. Darry bolts. He is to the door so fast he turns the knob before his sister can. EXT. FARMHOUSE. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish and Darry blasting outside. A flurry of fleeing cat also pour down the porch steps with them, spilling into t front yard. The kids scramble to their car. Trish flies behind the wheel and turns the key. Engine no turning over. Darry's eyes scanning the dark face of the farmhouse. MOR COMMOTION INSIDE. CATS SCREAMING. Trish with the key. Grinding the ignition. It starts.

head_text.subj: POWERFUL SHOWER OF GLASS AND WOOD.

text: The Creature leaps into the night. Darry and Trish watching it. Some kind of nightmare strea across the white of the half moon and then dropping down. Down into the yard.
Impossibly it lands on its feet. Crouched low to the grou Like some horrible beast ready to pounce. Putting its sites -those horrible blank eyes- on the kids

Go! Go! Go! The car squeals out of the yard, down the gravel drive an back toward the highway. Darry watching as the Creature sprints across the yard. Disappears in the darkness as the farmhouse gets smaller smaller...
You see his face? Trish grapples the wheel. Taking the dark highway as fast she is able. INT. TRISH'S CAR. COUNTRY HIGHWAY. NIGHT. SAME TIME.
Come on Trish, you see his face?! A sign flashes by: RATLROAD CROSSING 1/2 Mile
I know you saw it Goddamn it-
(matching his tone) One freaky thing at a time, alright?! Silence. Both staring ahead now. Darry whispering his new mantra.
He was wearing a mask. (looks to her) Trish? (off her look) He was wearing a mask.
Right.
You have to say it too.
He was wearing a mask.
The van is close -its headlights blasting the interior of car. Startling them as much as the horn.
What is this guy trying to do?!!
Darry! Trish has her own problem: up ahead The railroad crossing lights flashing, automated arms lowering AND BELLS ARE RINGING LOUDLY. Darry out the back squinting into the blaring headlights.

head_text.subj: THIS TIME THE TRAIN WHISTLE CALLS BACK TO IT.

text: Darry!!
Gun it, you can make it!!! The van is gaining. The train nearing. BELLS CLANGING THE WARNING.
Maybe down the tracks!
He'll kill us!
I can maybe get to the conductor!
Are you crazy?!!!
You gotta do this, Trish!
The van is all over both lanes, weaving back and forth. BLASTING THAT HIDEOUS, TAUNTING HORN.
He wants us to! Darry stares at her. She knows this?
Trish faster! !
(emphatically) We are going to die!!!!

Just do it!!! THE TRAIN HORN BLARES ITS FINAL WARNING. Trish slams the pedal to the metal and takes her sedan blasting through the barrier arms. It lurches across the track as the train roars at them li an iron beast. They fly over the tracks. The train just nicking their re bumper. Sends them spinning. Brother and sister collectively trying to grab the wheel. Spinning out of control while the train cuts them off fro the van. The van which slams on its brakes and swerves dangerously close to the tracks and the train. On the other side, the sedan stops spinning. Trish trying bearings. Darry still has his hands on the wheel with her
Let go of the wheel! Darry looks behind him. Nothing but the train CLANKING NOISILY over the tracks.
We gotta move! Trish grabs the gearshift but it won't budge. Darry sees
Something's wrong.
Don't say that. CLANK! CLANK! CLANK! The train's cars fly by -their only barrier from the van and their predator.
The gears are sticking-
(jaw tightening) Unstick ‘em, Trish!
What do you want me to do?! Trish and Darry both grapple the stick shift. Can't wrest the car into first gear.
Goddammit! !
You're gonna break it! Not seeing, as we do, something black shooting into the s from the other side of the train.
Bro and sis stare out the back: The Creature is crouched there -staring in at them with those horrible eyes.
He jumped over the train, Trish... Trish grinding that stickshift -trying with all her might

He jumped over the train, Trish! C1UNK! The car's transmission falls into gear and Trish g the engine. The car lurches ahead --jolting the Creature. It clutches sides of the car as she speeds forward. Darry in a stunned, numbed kind of shock. Trish dips onto the shoulder of the road. Trying to make ride rough. Swings across both lanes. Weaving erratically

Trying desperately to lose the thing on the trunk. Trish slams on the brakes. The car swings sideways violen Finally flinging it into the air. The kids watch as he flails into space. Coat flapping aro him -like a giant bat who has suddenly lost its equilibri Hitting the asphalt hard and rolling and skidding. Things falling out of his coat as he does. The battle axe CLANGING noisily on the ground and another insidious looking knife, bouncing on the asphalt with a couple of others --like the Creature, coming to an abrupt violent halt.

What the Hell are those? Trish just staring at the motionless heap of black under moonlight. The train's final car moves down the tracks behind them. Revealing the dark van just beyond the flashing railroad lights. Brother and sister staring ahead at the lifeless heap. TH

head_text.subj: SOUND OF THE TRAIN FADES IN THE DISTANCE AND THE BELLS AT

text: Silence now. Only the sound of their breathing in the car until Darry's whisper.
Hit him. She looks at her little brother.
Hit him, Trish. (off her look) Hard. She looks out the windshield. That lifeless mass sprawled the highway.
Do it! She opens her mouth to respond -when the Creature's head rises. It is staring at them. Those blind, ugly eyes burn out toward them.

Trish slams the pedal to the metal. Corrects the position the car and rockets forward with as much speed as she can build. The Creature's face caught in the glare of the headlights WHAM! Trish slams into it hard. The car's wheels pummel it savagely. Both kids grimacing

head_text.subj: THE TERRIBLE SOUNDS OF CRACKING AND CRUNCHING BENEATH THE

text: Trish stops now. Looks back at her handiwork. The cape has flapped over the Creature's head and its lifeless figure, complete with tire tracks, lays a little flatter on the two-lane. Brother and sister exchange glances.
You think he's dead?
They never are.

Right. Trish throws the car in reverse and speeds back at the lifeless shape. KER-POP! A sickeningly distinct sound as the tires roll o its legs this time. Trish comes to a halt behind it. Staring ahead into the h beams: there can be no mistaking this thing is flattened! On the asphalt, at the end of one coat sleeve, a hand lay crushed. Tire treads over it. Even bones crushed and flak like Greek pastry. Blowing away now. The whole hand blowing away. Dust in th wind.
In fact, LOTS of powder is blowing out from under that bl coat... The kids watch in awe: Have they crushed this thing to du
Let's get outta here.
I don't know how much farther this car's gonna go.

Far enough. Trish guns the engine again -a final trouncing for the Th in the road as they roar over it and speed into the dista INT. POHO COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPT. NIGHT. AN HOUR LATER. Trish on a payphone in the empty lobby. Darry next to her in. These kids have been through Hell and they look it.

It's the Poho County Sheriff's Department. It's right off the main highway about twenty miles before Trentdale. I am serious mom, we're okay. The car, I don't know. Tell dad we may have to have it towed someplace. Darry turns away for a moment. Caught by something on an opposite wall. A long bulletin board of missing persons. An ocean of fac Men, women and children. Some of the headings read: HAVE
I love you. See you when you get here. Darry stares ahead numbly. All the faces staring back at
Hey... (off his look) They're on their way. Be here in about an hour.
An hour and a half if mom drives.
Right.

Never thought I'd be so glad to see mom and dad. (looks to her) Actually looking forward to one of dad's "What in the name of God did you do now?" She smiles. In this look between them is a rare glimpse o their true love for each other.
We will do it you know? We will get home.

(recognizes her own words being used mockingly) Shut up! In from the night steps JEZELLE GAY HARTMAN. Heavy set. L forties. Sweet, plump face. In Capri pants, sneakers and sweatshirt, she is a woman on a mission.
Jezelle. The DESK SERGEANT is not happy to see her. She walks righ past him.
What can we do for you tonight... The Sergeant out from his desk. Moves after her.
Jezelle! Jezelle steps up to Trish and Darry. Studies them.
Come on Jezz’, they been through a lot, okay? She extends a plump hand. A tiny hint of a drawl in her h voice.
You the kids, then? Darry and Trish, you them?
Jez' Goddammit-
(shaking Trish’s hand) Jezelle Gay Hartman, how do you do?
Jezelle’s maybe a little confused about what’s going on down here tonight-
Less confused than Jerry here would like to think. (shakes Darry’s hand) If you were talking to his Captain? Captain John Develle who is off duty tonight? He'd tell you different.
Jezelle likes to think she’s the resident psychic around here. Behind her back, the Sergeant signals to the kids that sh not to be taken seriously.
She helped us on a missing persons a few years ago-
You think you could just let me talk to these kids for five minutes by myself?! THE PHONE AT THE DESK CHIRPING INCESSANTLY. The Sergeant moves to answer it.
Go home, turn that Goddamned police scanner off and go to bed.
And you go do something useful, you got officers missing!
I mean it Jezelle, leave ‘em alone. Trish and Darry left staring at the woman.

You don’t have to believe I’m psychic. But I can tell you something these cops haven't. (off their look) That dust they got off your car back at Delroy’s? It tested as human skin over a hundred and fifty years old. Darry and Trish listen to her.
That didn’t come in a dream. I heard it on the police scanner. I got more to tell you and I come a long way to do it.
You know I’m really not sure we should be talking to anybody right now-
I know what it is. Her voice a sudden and urgent whisper.
I know what’s chasing you. She has their full attention now.
You found a lot of bodies. (off Darry’s incredulous look) Down in that cellar. I saw ‘em too. (swallows ) You see the cats yet? I saw you with cats too. Lots of cats-
You called. At the diner, that was you.
I saw those bodies just like you did. That poor boy with the stitches all down him... I saw you there with him.
How?
Dreamed it. (waits for a response) I dream a lot of things. The woman's self-assuredness is dissolving. She stares at them with eyes flickering with fear and sadness.
Those bodies down there. You found its house of pain. Darry doesn’t know why but his blood runs cold.
I don’t know how I know that, I just... know that’s what it likes to call it.
What ...likes to call it?
It’s got a whole lotta names. From a whole lotta different times and places. Eater of the Dead... That’s the one that keeps coming to me.
Eater of the... (off her nod) What does that mean, it eats people?
It has to. (off their stunned looks) It has incredible power. That’s how it stays that way. How it's lived so long. Trish tries to leave. Brother holds her arm. Won’t let he
I don't like having this in my head. I don't like knowing this and not knowing why I do... (MORE )
JEZELLE (cont'd) Every twenty-third Spring. For twenty-three days. It gets to eat. Whatever it needs. It eats eyes so it can see. It eats lungs so it can breathe...
(standing, pointedly) I’m gonna be sick. Darry would you come and help me throw up, please?
Look this thing has had chances to kill us, and it didn't. This makes Jezelle even more uncomfortable. What she now to say.

(swallows, her eyes dampening) It's very particular. Only wants ...certain parts from certain bodies. One of you has something it might like. (Darry swallows) It won't stop following until it knows for sure.
By trying to run us off the road?!
(shakes her head 'yes', her voice a cutting whisper) It needs to scare you. (find's Trish's eyes) There's something in fear. Something it can smell. Brother and sister stare at her.
Makes it easier for it. To know if there's anything ina person it might ..like.
Like?
Wants.
Wants?
+...to eat.

Oh fuck you! EXT. POHO COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Many off duty patrol cars. TWO OFFICERS just sitting down theirs. Coffee cups in hand. Engine turns over and they r out of the lot. While at the opposite end, an old dark van rolls into vie Its familiar license plate vibrating slightly with the ro idle of the engine:
Now we think about the other way this plate could be read Eating You.....

I don't know what it is exactly. If it's a Demon or a Devil or just some hungry thing from a wicked place somewhere in time. The van door swings open. Engine still running as one of Creature's feet sets down on the asphalt. It's black shoe marred with a tire track.

I just know it's been doing this for a lot longer than a hundred and fifty years. And it is not gonna stop. Coming after you or anyone else it wants to. The other leg swings out awkwardly. Out of a tattered pan leg the foot hangs -barely attached. Only by a length of flesh and a torn sock...
‘Cause once it has the scent of something it likes...? With this horrid handicap, the Creature starts a grizzly, almost comical limp across the shadowy parking lot....
It can't. It can't stop. INT. POHO COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Jezelle pleading with Darry and Trish. Her voice an urgen whisper:

And you don't know how you know that, you just do, right?! Jezelle stares at her. Eyes welling. Looks so sad. Like h heart is breaking. Like there is something else she knows Something too terrible for her to say.
What? Jezelle shakes her head no. Can't speak it.
What else? Darry takes her by her plump arms. Forces her to look at
Goddammit you told us this much now what else?!
(the quietest whisper) I told you. Jeepers Creepers.
I heard it. (off Jezelle’s look) At the diner. Nothing happened.
No. It’s playing on an old phonograph. (MORE )
JEZELLE (cont'd) (tries to sing in her frighted whisper) Jeepers Creepers, where'd you get those peepers? Darry and Trish looking at each other. This lady has real gone over the edge.

(can barely say it) I hear it playing while one of you is screaming. (her eyes find Trish) Screaming down in the dark somewhere. Screaming the last scream you'll ever- SUDDENLY LIGHTS OUT! THE HALL PLUNGED INTO DARKNESS. The Desk Sergeant lifts the phone.
We got lights out up here. The facility has come to an abrupt standstill. Trish, Dar and Jezelle, eyes toward the ceiling.
(a whisper) It's gone. We ran it over until there was nothing left. (meets Jezelle's eyes in the dark) We killed it.
It's eaten too many hearts for it's own to ever stop.

location: POHO SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT. JAIL LEVEL. NIGHT. SAME T

text: A flashlight blares out the dark as OFFICER TIM MCCURRY starts the long walk down a shadowy row of cells.
Heads up gentlemen. His flashlight falls over the first cell. Two bodies slee in upper and lower bunks.
I said heads up, gentlemen. Show me some skin.
The INMATE in the upper bunk stares groggily into the gla of the flashlight.
What the Hell's wrong with you, man?

We have a black out gentlemen. That means emergency head count. (drops his beam to the lower bunk) Lower bunk show me some skin. An angry hand juts out from under the blanket -middle fin extended. The Officer moves onto the next cell.

Head count gentlemen... UPPER AND LOWER BUNKMATES peer into the beam. Officer McC moves to the next. Stops when he hears A SOUND. ..-A WET SOUND. McCurry follows it. Moves quickly past several more cells THE SOUND HAS GONE FROM SLURPING TO CRUNCHING.... He is at the end of hall now. Approaching the last and darkest cell. The flashlight falling over something McCur cannot believe: The bars to this cell have been bent outward and apart. McCurry fumbles with his free hand to get his service pis out of his holster. Takes another step: The man in the cell freezes when the beam of light hits h Dressed in a long black coat. Squatting over something on floor. McCurry looks down: The body of AN INMATE lies in a pool of dark blood. At th end of his right leg -the foot has been chewed completely off... McCurry in shock. The Figure, ignoring the Officer's presence now, returns his work. Bows his head. Suddenly thrashing it back and forth. The lifeless inmate rocking with the same violent motions.

McCurry moving fast now. Leaps before the cell. Levels hi pistol. The Figure's head drops back. McCurry halted by that horrible WET, CRUNCHING SOUND as t inmate's arm falls into view: His hand gone. A bloody stump adding more crimson to the floor. McCurry cocks his pistol. The sound is loud and causes th Figure to turn. Slowly. Until he is staring up at McCurry past the gun barrel. McCurry paralyzed: The Creature's white eyes glaring up a him. Its mouth and chin a bloody mess... McCurry should have fired by now. Too perplexed and horri at what he is staring at... THWAMM!!! It moves so fast, McCurry only feels the bars o the cell slamming into his face -and service pistol flyin out of his hand with the impact. He has been grappled, in a blurring moment of speed, thro the bars of the cell by the Creature's one good hand. The other hand: non-existent. Just an empty sleeve as he holds Officer McCurry against those bars. Nose to nose. Surveying the Officer. Those malevolent whi eyes staring into him.

head_text.subj: THE SOUND OF TRICKLING. SOMETHING TRICKLING ONTO THE GROU

text: Both cop and Creature look down at the Creature's empty sleeve. A grayish powder trickles out of it. And with it, a new hand. Drops down from inside the sleev and splays its fingers. Replacing the one pummelled into by the tire of Trish's car. The Creature takes McCurry's head in both hands now. Lean in. Close. Closer... And sniffs. Sniffs him. Leans in now. Inhales him. Savori his scent. -To the Officer's horror and surprise.

head_text.subj: LEVELS THOSE MALEVOLENT EYES AT HIM NOW --AND ROARS, THE
CREATURE'S MOUTH GAPING OPEN AND COLLIDING WITH HIS HEAD.

text: We cannot see clearly what is happening at the dark end o the corridor -just McCurry's arms and legs flailing madly HE SCREAMS. INT. POHO COUNTY SHERIFF'S DEPARTMENT. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Emergency lights flickering on. Tiny pools of light from corners of the ceiling.
About Goddamned time. Trish, Darry and Jezelle staring up at them. Lots of acti suddenly. Officers everywhere moving around in the semi-d
All right we are going to a lock down situation, people. That means everybody sit tight, and don't move unless somebody wearing a badge tells you to.
He's here. Trish and Darry look almost angry at her for having said this. She regards them. Nods in a chilling affirmation.
You kids wanna come with me? All three whirl around, startled by the Sergeant, suddenl behind them in the dark.
We're gonna put you in a room down the hall here. With Jezelle in tow, down the dark hall.

Uh-uh. (points a thumb at Jezelle) Not you, lady Sherlock. (calls out) Someone escort Jezelle here back to the big, blue Winnebago she's no doubt blocking the driveway with. Two Officers step up to escort her away.
(full of ire) These kids are still in trouble! I might still be able to help ‘em-
I told you: outta here!
You don't see what's about to happen-
(to the Officers) Let's get Ms. Hartman out of here, please. The Officers start to back her up. She looks to Trish and Darry with the most frightened eyes.
He's gonna find you in here! He's gonna find you ‘less you get out-
Alright now Goddammit knock it off!! The Officers take her by the arms now.
Get away from me!
I swear I will lock you up, Jezz'!
(looks to Darry) You believe me?!! Her frightened eyes burning out at him.
You believe what I said?! Darry panicking. Doesn't want to believe. Moves toward he she is ushered toward the exit.
I didn't know if it would help but I had to tell you what I knew!
Are your dreams ever wrong?! Jezelle just staring at him.
Your dreams, are they ever wrong?!! Darry unnerved by the horrible sadness on her face. DARRY (cont'd) You know, don’t you?
You have to get out of here!
You know who dies! You know which one of us!
Don’t let them lock you anywhere in this building-
You know but you don’t have the guts to tell us! Jezelle looking helpless. Eyes frozen on Darry.
CRACKLING OVER A NEARBY OFFICER’S WALKIE.
(filtered) Up top -this is the basement. We have a 10-34. I repeat a 10-
The officer takes his walkie off his belt. The Desk Serge hurries to listen in. Lots of commotion on the other end.
(filtered) Anybody on groundlevel!
(grabs the walkie) Kribbs, Go ahead!
(filtered) We got a situation down here Sarge'!
(filtered) Its headed toward you! Up the rear stairs! You copy?! Trish and Darry exchanging looks. Impossible. Can’t be hi
(filtered) Coming up the rear stairwell! Pandemonium in the dark. Officers racing toward the end o the lobby.
(to Trish and Darry) Stay here! He runs back down the hall -past Jezelle staring at them.
We gotta get you outta here. She moves fast for a big woman. Heading down the dark corridor. Away from the lobby.

Come on I said! They move with her. Darry taking a final look back at the lobby where Officers now hug the walls. Staring down a corridor that ends in the rear stairwell. The Sergeant stares with the others at the dark stairwell Illuminated by a single dollop of light from one of the emergency overheads. Four cops flank the walls before it. Weapons drawn. The Sergeant hisses an urgent whisper into his walkie.
Somebody talk to me down there!
(filtered) We have one inmate and an officer down! More officers responding. Running out of the dark. The Sergeant waves them back.
(filtered) Ramirez too, he’s hurt bad. Son-of-a-bitch tried to take a bite out of him!

What?! A shadow falling over the stairwell. Someone headed up th stairs. MORE GUN SHOTS. Flashes from below etching the shadow whi suddenly flickers up the wall and out of view. Officers staring puzzled. Where did this guy go?

(filtered) This guy is wearing something ‘cause we cannot take him down! Copy? We cannot take him down! They can hear something moving. Getting closer. Guns aime down those dark stairs. One of the Officers, DANE, looks to the Sergeant. Gets a Dane moves forward. Hugging the wall. Very close to the stairwell now. Jumps aside the doorway. Braves a look down. Nothing on t stairs. Hears something in the stillness... A sniffing sound. Somewhere in the dark. They can all hea it. Puzzled by it. Down the stairs? Officer Dane looks back at the Sergeant. seeing what everyone else does behind him: THE CREATURE’S HEAD DROPPING INTO VIEW FROM ABOVE.
Hanging upside down just inside the stairwell doorway! Th officers swing their guns to this horrible visage when -

OFFICER DANE’S FACE ERUPTS IN SHOCK! SPRAYED SUDDENLY WIT CRIMSON. HIS CHEST HAS THE CREATURE’S HAND STICKING OUT O IT. HE HAS PUNCHED RIGHT THROUGH IT! In the Creature's horrib hand -THE OFFICER'S STILL-PUMPING HEART! The Creature swings back up out of view. Taking his blood parcel with him. The men staring ahead in shock. Dane just stares wide-eyed with the hole in his chest. SLURPING AND GARGLING SOUNDS as the unseen Creature inges what onlookers don't want to believe he could be. The heartless Officer tries to say something now but can' manage it. Falls back and tumbles down the stairs. The Desk Sergeant and his men are the color of chalk as t regard each other in the terrible, silent shadows of the hall.... KER-OOSSSHHHHH! !!!! The ceiling over the doorway erupts. Plaster and dust flying everywhere as the Creature blasts through the wall and onto his feet before the startled onlookers. He is instantly moving. Stepping forward in long powerful strides through the dust and the confusion --directly at Officers and their guns. Everyone opens fire -bullets ripping through the Creature

head_text.subj: ONE OFFICER SCREAMS BEHIND HIM -HIS BODY RIDDLED WITH THE
SAME BULLETS --FLYING RIGHT THROUGH THE CREATURE AND INTO

text: The men watch in horror as the Officer flails back and crashes to the floor. The Creature reaches out. Yanks another off his feet. Twitches and convulses as the grip cuts off his air. The Creature still moving. With his other hand, grips the Officer by the groin. Holds him out now. A human shield a strides down the dark corridor watching the other Officer retreat in shock and confusion. Two Officers behind him, running at him. One has his pist leveled. The other screaming at him not to shoot.

No!!! Charges ahead himself. A flying tackle at the Creature’s back. But it is like hitting a mountain. He hits hard and hangs on -grappling the Creature around the neck. The Creature still moving. Not even slowed. One man hangi on his back and one he still holds in front of him. Others retreating. Scared. What the Hell is this thing?!

Goddammit !!! The Sergeant remains in the middle of the hall -his revol aimed at the approaching nightmare. The Officer on the Creature’s back starts to pistol whip Desperately trying to stop him. But in a swift and viciou move, it swings around -slamming its back into the neares wall. Slamming it hard. The Officer with it. The plaster on the wall cracks with the impact. The Officer's eyes go wide as he spits blood. He collapse the floor in a heap as the Creature continues on. His hum shield staring at him -eyes bulging. Air still cut off.

Goddammit stop!!! You stop right fucking there!!! The Creature raises his human shield over his head. Befor the men can fire at his exposed chest --hurls the Officer them. But this is no ordinary throw -the man is rocketing down corridor as if propelled out of a catapult. Men are diving out of his way. One taken out completely. Tumbling down the corridor with him and smashing into a g trophy case.
