text: INT. POHO SHERIFF’S DEPARTMENT BACK HALL. NIGHT. SAME TIM Trish, Darry and Jezelle hurrying through the darkness. C hear the chaos in the distance. Come upon a large rear do with a safety bar and an alarm.
Darry tries it. Won’t open. Tries it again viciously. Whi to Jezelle.
This is your way out?!
The doors must lock automatically in a power out.
You didn’t know that?!
Well I'm sorry honey but I can't dream everything now can
Eyes and ears on alert: the distant commotion is suddenly still. Deathly still.
We have to get upstairs!
We have to get out!
There’s no other way out down here except the front.
How are we gonna get out from upstairs!? Darry sees it first: At the far end of the hall. A famili silhouette. Still. Impassive.

Upstairs. Trish and Darry dash up the stairs and The Creature takes toward them like a rocket. Sprints so fast his coat billows in his wake, like dark w Jezelle just kneels. No chance she could make it up those stairs fast enough. Instead, bows her head in prayer as t Creature races toward her.
Our Father who art in Heaven, hallowed be Thy name...

The Creature is so close she can feel his wind... can fee blasting past her. Her moment of doom has passed quickly. She turns and sees Creature racing up the stairs at top speed. INT. SHERIFF’S DEPARTMENT SECOND STORY. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish and Darry running for their lives. Where to they do know. The corridors are dark and maze-like. Stopping finally. Confused whether to keep moving or find place and hide. They don’t have to think long. The Creature roars into vi ahead of them and they start a nightmare flight back into maze. The Creature pursues with incredible speed. The kids practically falling around corners they are running so fa Behind them like some Dark Avenger, the Creature soars. Gaining. Always gaining. Rounds another corner and halts: The kids gone. Several d they could've slipped into. He chooses one. The Creature in the doorway. This is an interrogation roo Dark and empty. Caught by its own reflection in the large mirror on the wall. A two-way mirror. On the other side, Trish and Darry, watching breathless. Terrified as the Creature surveys th mirror and steps toward it. The kids silent. Holding each other. The terrible visage the Thing pressed against the glass now. Does it sense something behind it? Those white eyes staring in. As if they could see through And then its tongue comes out. Long. Licks the glass from to high in some horrible, pre-culinary gesture. Trish and Darry watching with repulsion. Then relief. Hav left a snail trail on the mirror, the Creature is turning away. Turning away from the mirror and- KER-TASSSSHHH! !!! The plexi-window explodes as the Creat crashes through it. Trish and Darry scrambling back in a blind panic and a shower of glass.

The Creature in the center of the room. Poised like an animal, ready to pounce. Trish and Darry can barely move. Paralyzed with fear as t Thing steps closer. Backs them to the wall. Brother and sister, side by side. Those hideous milky eyes glare at Trish. Burning into her Watches as he inches closer. Darry starts to move. Pinned against the wall instantly b the Creature's iron grip. Pinned there watching as the Creature moves even closer to his sister.
(barely a whisper) Darry... Nose to nose now they are so close. She can feel the horr stench of his cannibal breath. Its horrible, raspy whispe now:

Sister, sister... Watches in terror as it gets so close she thinks it might kiss her... But it sniffs her instead. Short little sniffs at first. Darry and Trish watching th in horror. Then sniffs long and deep as Trish stares full of fear, i those horrible eyes. Eyes that close as another deep inhale commences. They op again -abruptly. Stares at her a moment longer and tosses aside. The Creature instantly on Darry. Nose to nose. A big deep inhale as little brother watches. Tries to find his siste somewhere on the floor. His whisper like a child's.
Please let me smell bad... Please let me smell bad, Trish... Another long inhale. This time, the Creature’s head drops back. Darry can see the nostrils. Flaring. Fluttering. Nostrils don’t flutter.

They do it again. As if the scent they were sampling, sen his nostrils into uncontrollable twitching.... There can be no doubt, as the Creature levels those eyes Darry -that it has found what it wants. Something about o inside him it finds irresistible...

Its gonna eat me Trish.... This motherfucker’s gonna eat me.... CLINK CLANK! RIFLES BEING COCKED. BIG ONES. The Creature halts but doesn’t turn. The shattered window the other room is filled with FOUR OFFICERS IN RIOT GEAR. Sergeant their leader.
Step away from the kid. The Creature still doesn’t move. Stares at Darry.

(cont‘d) Darius? Just step this way with your sister. Darry stares at the Creature for a long moment. Then slow inches down the wall. The Creature watching him. Once out from under him, Darry scrambles to Trish and the fly out the door into the hall. The Creature turns toward them, but all rifles raise. The Creature slowly raises his head -eyes glaring at them from an angry furrowed brow that seems to say Who in the fuck do you think you are? The Creature roars toward them and the guns blaze. INT. POHO SHERIFF’S DEPARTMENT STAIRWELL. NIGHT. SAME TIM AS THE SOUNDS OF A WAR RAGE OVERHEAD, Trish and Darry scramble down a stairwell that empties into the dark lobb Halted by the bodies scattered everywhere. Like a massacr ONE BODY sticking half out a plexi-glass window he was th through. A BODY at the corner of the Sergeant’s desk is just a tor His bottom half no where to be seen...

Trish and Darry blast forward. Sprinting through the atrocities and toward the entrance. The glass doors -also shattered by AN OFFICER'S BODY hanging half in and out. They step over him and out to the parking lot. EXT. POHO COUNTY SHERIFF'S BLDG. EXT. NIGHT. SAME TIME. Trish and Darry searching frantically for their car. They Jezelle’s Winnebago. But not a sign of their own vehicle. way to drive out of here. Except for the Creature’s black van still idling in the corner of the lot. MORE GUNSHOT BLASTS and flashes from the second story. To Darry, the choice is simple. He is sprinting toward th van.
No! Little brother sprints to the driver door and throws it o A STENCH SO FOUL meets him that he has to grimace. Thinks twice about this now.
I am not doing this Darry!

DARRY (cont'd) Trisha! !!!! Before their bodies can even hit the ground, Darry braves stench. Leaps up into the driver’s seat. Reaches instinctively for the ignition. No key. The van is runnin without a key in the ignition. Clutches the gear shift. Sticky. Looks at his palm. Stick congealed, crimson goo. Its like a thin film over everything. The passenger door flies open. Trish reaching out for brother’s hand. Halting with the stench. Staring at him. He just gives her arm a good yank and she is up and flyin into the seat. The van rattling with her weight. And soun like a windchime?

They look behind them and see why: the van walls are line with an incredible and grizzly array of spears, axes and knives. All hanging from mounted hooks -THE WEAPONS CLANKING AND TINKLING TOGETHER WITH THE MOVEMENT OF THE VAN. Blades all stained by an eternity of atrocities. The Creature appears now. On the roof of the building. Da staring in horror at him from the van window. Even at thi distance, caught in his terrifying, demon-blind glare.

What the Hell are you waiting for?! Darry grapples the sticky gear shift again -tries to get in first. THE GEARS GRIND -SHRIEKING AS IF THEY WERE SOUL BEING TORTURED. The Creature vaults forward. Leaping impossibly off the r of the building and onto the roof of Jezelle’s Winnebago. Landing on his feet. Glaring at Darry. Starting across th parking lot. Not on the ground. He has leapt into the air and is leapi from police car roof to police car roof with each stride.

Hang on! Damned gears. They grind away. Trish staring back -the Creature leaping from car to car some nightmare gymnast. Its tattered coat flapping like d distressed wings. Darry finally forces the gearshift forward. Doesn’t know he’s in first or not. Guns it. It lurches roughly and stops. Must be in second. The Creature hits one final car top and vaults into space directly at them.
Darry!!! The van lurches forward again. Moving now but not fast.
KE--RONKKK!!! The Creature smacks into the side of the va His face rearing up into Darry’s window. Staring in. Darr terrified. Still trying to get up speed.

Give me something!! Trish out of her seat. The van lurching again. Throws her into the back. Tries to keep her balance. SPEARS AND BATT AXES CLANGING ALL AROUND HER. The Creature rakes his claw-like fingers across the glass a circular motion. Slicing into it with A HORRIBLE SHRIEK
Get me something! !!! The Creature rears his hand back -ready to strike the cir he has scored in the glass...

Trish- Something smacks into the palm of Darry's hand. He doesn’ even take time to see what it is. Just swings it at the window hard. KER-TASSHHH!!!! He hits the Creature directly in the face with a small combination hatchet/hammer. Glass flying out everywhere as the Creature drops off the van. Crashing to earth as Darry speeds away.
Yesss!ii!ii!! Trish watching. Wants to smile too. Shout with joy like h brother.

(shouting into the rearview) Motherfucker! !!!! But instead Trish stares out the back windows of the van. Watching the dazed Creature raising his head. Staring aft them as they get further and further away. Darry guns the engine. The van is really moving now. Roar away from the Sheriff's building and down the empty two l
Darry... A warning from sis. Brother checks out the rearview: the distant Creature is on his feet now. And running. Running toward them.
(his smile more manic now) He’s kidding right? In his rearview: the Creature sprinting after them. Sprin like Hell.

He’s not getting smaller... He is actually gaining on them. His legs a blur of darkne he is coming so fast. Darry checking the speedometer: the van is doing 120 mile hour. And the Creature is gaining on him.

You mother..... Darry’s foot flattening the gas pedal. To the floorboards The old van shakes and quakes at this velocity. THE SPEAR AND AXES CLANKING NOISILY. Then another impossible nightmare: the sprinting Creature without slowing down- throws himself forward like an acro doing a running tumble-- But when he completes his flip -landing on his feet again uses the momentum to push off. And in an affront to gravi everywhere: rockets himself up into the night sky. Up and gone. Out of view. Brother and sister both saw it. Look to each other.
THE VAN’S TRAJECTORY. IT WEAVES ACROSS THE ROAD. DARRY TR TO WIN BACK CONTROL. KA-RANKK!!!! The Creature's battle axe punches a hole in top of the van, right in front of Darry’s face.
Trish!!! She scrambles for one of the spears. Grabs a shorter one. Thrusts it straight up. Over her brother's head.

THWAAMMPPPP!!! Pierces the roof and puncture’s the creature’s head. Directly above the eyes! The Creature loses his grip on the van, slides back and o falling onto the road again. Darry watching in the rearview.
Yes!!! Hits the asphalt hard. The spear dislodges as it rolls ov and over down the two lane.

Yessss!!! Rolls and rolls and suddenly leaps up, lands on his feet keeps on coming! Darry’s enthusiasm gone. Just watches breathless as this inhuman thing comes at them again! The Creature has never moved faster. So fast powder is co off his skin, a skin being eaten away by the actual wind shear at this velocity.
Yeah! Burn your ass up you son- of-a-bitch! He is like a comet now -a rocket of dust blasting down th highway toward the van.

Watch it... Trish scrambling for another weapon. THE CREATURE’S VELOCITY IS MAKING ITS OWN HISSING SOUND.. Brother and sister listening to it grow LOUDER AND LOUDER Trish with an angry looking battle axe at the ready. Sees SCREAMING dust storm is almost upon them. KA-POOOMMM!!!! The back doors blast inward as the Creatur explodes into the van. Trish thrown ahead against the dash. Darry losing control again. The van hits the shoulder of the road hard! Inside the Creature advances. Trish lurching forward with axe at the ready for him. She swings it:

THWOCK!!! HIS HEAD IS NEATLY SLICED OFF. Leaves a small p of dust at his neck as it rolls right out the back of the and down the highway. The Creature’s headless body staggering back. Trish stari at it. Charges ahead with the same weapon and hurls it! Direct hit! Knocks the torso back out the doors. It hits the asphalt hard and goes rolling and rolling in sporadic puffs of dust...
Yes!!! The van roars ahead. In the distance. A TRAIN WHISTLE. Da listening to it. Looks at his sister.
Where is he?! Trish takes no time to stare out the windows again.
He’s dead! He doesn’t have a head!!!
He’s not!
Darry! He doesn’t have a fucking head!!
He’s not!
How’s he supposed to eat any thing without a head?!!! Brother and sister staring breathless at each other. Darr words are calm now. Almost whispered.
He’s not gonna stop. (emphatically) He is never gonna stop, Trish!!! The Railway crossing ahead. The CLANKING SOUND of the WAR BELLS and the Automatic arms.
Get out!
She can’t believe he said this.
I mean it, get out! (off her incredulous look) There’s grass over there!
He’s dead!
He’s not! We both know he’s not! THE TRAIN HORN BLASTS NOW. A warning it is almost to the crossing.
Do it!!

What the Hell’re you gonna do?! KA-RANNKKK!!!! Down comes the Creature’s hand again, maki larger hole in the roof of the van, grappling for Darry’s head. It finds him. Holds on tight. Darry screaming. Trish race forward.

Look out!!! She swings the axe again! THWOMP!!! The hand grappling he brother is severed. It falls to the ground and she kicks out the back of the van. It hits hard in a cloud of dust... Up top: the armless, headless Creature reaches down again with his one remaining arm...
Goddammit Trish, I’m not doing this for nothing-

You're not doing anything without me! She takes another long sharp spear and thrusts it through roof of the van. Up top: the spear-head pierces the Creature’s headless to pinning it to the top of the van. This makes him more angry. His remaining arm reaching dow for Darry -grapples with new violence for his head. Finds Darry trying to wrench it off him. It starts to pull him upward. Trish runs forward with her axe but little brother surpri her. Grabs her arm and pulls her onto his lap.
Darry! Forces the axe out of her hand. Kicks open his door. Look terrified as he flashes a last look at her.

Bye sis- Throws his sister out of the van. She screams as she hits soft grass and rolls and rolls. The train is upon them. WARNING BELLS DEAFENING. LIGHTS FLASHING. And Darry clutching the arm of the Creature as tight as h can. The creature lifting him -up out of his seat. Darry fighting it. Bracing himself with his hands against roof of the van.
You got me?! You got me you son-of- a-bitch?! Huh?!

text: Trish is already crying. Sobbing as the blast lights her bruised and bleeding face. It is raining debris now. Fiery debris and bits and piece cloth and metal. But nothing human. Nothing inhuman for that matter. Trish stares ahead from the grass. Sobs. Inconsolable in the ta grass.

text: Trish in a police car. In the back seat. Wrapped in a blanket. Still in shock. Workers sifting through the ash debris of what lay across the tracks. Jezelle knocks on the window. Trish rolls it down.
Your parents are waiting for you back at the Sheriff's Building. I heard it on the scanner. Trish doesn’t look at her. Just stares out. Jezelle draws breath and starts to step away.
Your dreams are wrong. Jezelle stops. Turns and looks at her.
Sometimes. Darry didn't die like you said he would.
Sometimes.

Jezelle nods in silent agreement. Though there is somethi in her eyes we cannot discern. She turns away. Moves toward her Winnebago. Trisha lookin on. Somewhere we hear the tune Jeeper’s Creeper’s. Instrument version. Playful. Strange in this grim context as we:

Somewhere off that same country two lane, in the long sha of the dying sun, this old packing plant sits. It is rust and sagging and as we approach, and our music continues, begin moving down. Down toward the ground beneath the old structure.... INT. OLD PACKING PLANT. BASEMENT LEVEL. NIGHT. In dank darkness, the music continues. Sounds like it's playing on a phonograph somewhere. Yes a phonograph. The kind with lots of analog hiss. We move toward the music, along an empty wall. At the end of which, in the long shadows, a tall figure i cape-like coat busies himself. Though we can’t tell with until we are up close. Sewing. Stitching. Fingers working nimbly with coarse bla thread. We see now the wall is not entirely empty. Several bodies mounted there. Not the ancient dead we have seen undergro at the church. These are fresher. Of much more recent demise. Sewn toget in the same grizzly fashion we know too well. And then KER-PLUNK! A new body is hung next to them. Hung a hook which we cannot see. Young Darry. Eye lids sewn shut with large, nasty looking stitches. The latest addition in this new mural of human horrors.

The instrumental bridge of the song ends and the lyrics e in this vast underground chamber. ...-Jeepers Creepers, where’d you get those Peepers? Jeep Creepers, where’d you get those eyes? Echoing as we begin to back away from this sad and grizzl sight... the Creature beginning to sew Darry onto the oth As this begins WE SLOWLY FADE TO BLACK as our song contin ...-Jeepers Creepers, where’d you get those Peepers? Jeep Jeepers, Weepers Creepers, where did you get those eyes?
